newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Storms kill at least 22 people in Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: Storms kill at least 22 people in Pakistan.

text.p: Torrential rain accompanied by thunder and lightning killed at least 22 people in a village in northern Pakistan on Saturday, officials said.
They said three houses had collapsed overnight, burying their occupants in debris, in the village of Kund Jabir in the Mansehra district of North West Frontier Province.
The overnight storms damaged several other houses in the village. The victims belonged to two families.
Rescue workers, police and local officials rushed to Kund Jabir, where at least 22 bodies had been recovered by Saturday evening. Six missing people were feared dead, officials said.
